meanings.definition: To replace the facing on (a building or surface)
meanings.sent1: The old bricks were refaced with shiny new ones.
meanings.sent2: The contractor refaced the entire storefront with elegant marble.
meanings.sent3: The building looked like it had a new face after being refaced.
meanings.sent4: She refaced the worn-out facade, transforming it into a modern masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: After the renovation, the building was refaced and looked brand new.

meanings.definition: To give a new facing to (a building or surface)
meanings.sent1: The team refaced the exterior walls of the house with colorful tiles.
meanings.sent2: They decided to refaced the kitchen cabinets with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: The house felt like it got a makeover after being refaced.
meanings.sent4: The artist refaced the mural on the wall, breathing new life into it.
meanings.sent5: The old fireplace was refaced with beautiful stone, enhancing the room's charm.
